title: Urgent antigen kits to be imported
byline: The Ministry of Health is set to import additional stocks of COVID-19 antigen test kits as a precautionary measure amidst growing concerns over a new global variant of the virus, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Candidates declaring LG Polls election expenses at an exceptionally pleasing rate – EC
byline: Declaring campaign finances of the contestants of the recently concluded Local Government polls 2025 is at an exceptionally pleasing rate where over 66, 000 out of 75, 500 candidates have submitted their election expenses thus far, a senior election commission official said.

title: Putin will seek revenge for Ukraine drone attack, warns Trump
byline: Vladimir Putin has said he will have to respond to Ukraine’s major drone attack on Russian airbases, US President Donald Trump has warned.

title: I am not disappointed that I did not enter the top 40. I was realistic about it: Anudi Gunasekara
byline: Miss Sri Lanka for Miss World 2025, Anudi Gunasekara who recently returned back to the country after participating in the pageant in India said she was not disappointed for failing to enter the top 40 and had been realistic about this throughout the competition.

title: World Bank Identifies Sri Lanka too hot for people to work 6 hours a Day
byline: Sri Lanka is among a few South Asian countries identified with a temperature level that is considered too hot for people to be able to work safely outdoors for an average of six hours a day, according to a report compiled by the World Bank.

title: Colombo Port transshipment decline enters 4th month; April dips 5.8%
byline: The Port of Colombo’s transshipment volumes recorded a 5.8 percent year-on-year (YoY) decline in April 2025, reaching 495,456 twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs), marking the fourth consecutive month of slowdown in this crucial segment.

title: SVAT repeal expected to add Rs.191bn annually to VAT coffers
byline: The upcoming repeal of the Simplified Value Added Tax (SVAT) regime is projected to significantly bolster Sri Lanka’s Value Added Tax (VAT) revenue, with an estimated additional Rs.191 billion expected to flow into state coffers annually.

title: Pakistan teen TikTok star shot dead
byline: A 22-year-old man has been arrested in Pakistan and confessed to the murder of 17-year-old social media influencer Sana Yousaf, according to the Pakistan police.

title: Hungry elephant wanders into Thai grocery store
byline: A hungry elephant from Khao Yai National Park in Thailand has caused havoc in a local corner store, helping himself to produce on the shelves. The elephant, named Plai Biang Lek, is known by locals for entering people’s homes in search of food.

title: Match-fixing allegations: Indictment filed against Sachithra Senanayake
byline: The Attorney General has filed an indictment before the Hambantota High Court against former Sri Lankan cricketer Sachindra Madushanka Senanayake over allegations of attempting to induce national cricketer Tharindu Hasanka Ratnayake into match-fixing during a cricket tournament held in Sri Lanka in 2020.

title: Govt earns Rs. 136 Bn from vehicle imports in first 4 months
byline: The Government has generated Rs. 136 billion in revenue from motor vehicle imports between January and April 2025.

title: Trump bans nationals from 12 countries, citing security concerns
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a proclamation on Wednesday banning the nationals of 12 countries from entering the United States, saying the move was needed to protect against ’’foreign terrorists’’ and other security threats.

title: Putin will seek revenge for Ukraine drone attack, warns Trump
byline: Vladimir Putin has said he will have to respond to Ukraine’s major drone attack on Russian airbases, US President Donald Trump has warned.

title: SriLankan Airlines  welcomes first wide-body  aircraft in seven years
byline: SriLankan Airlines yesterday welcomed an Airbus A330-200  wide-body aircraft to its existing fleet of 22 aircraft, aiming to  expand its services. The state-run airline expects to add at least two  more aircraft by the end of this year.

title: Pakistan teen TikTok star shot dead
byline: A 22-year-old man has been arrested in Pakistan and confessed to the murder of 17-year-old social media influencer Sana Yousaf, according to the Pakistan police.

title: Catastrophe during RCB victory parade; 11 dead, more than 25 seriously injured in stampede
byline: The high élan over Royal challengers Bengaluru’s maiden IPL quest turned into grief after 11 people died in a stampede during a victory parade in Bengaluru. More than 25 are feared to be seriously injured with children included in the list. The death toll is likely to rise.

title: Stretch connecting Kadawatha, Central Expressway to commence in August: Bimal
byline: The construction work of the stretch connecting Kadawatha and the Central Expressway will commence in August this year, Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka and National University of Singapore sign MoU on higher education cooperation
byline: In a significant step towards strengthening international educational ties, the Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education Ministry of Sri Lanka has officially signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Higher Education Cooperation with the National University of Singapore (NUS), one of Asia’s most prestigious higher education institutions.

title: SriLankan to pay USD 275,000 monthly for new airbus: Minister
byline: SriLankan Airlines has to pay only a USD 275,000 monthly fee to the new airbus leased by the SriLankan airlines from France, Transport Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today.

title: Government may impose price cap on salt: Trade Minister
byline: The government will be compelled to introduce a Maximum Retail Price (MRP) for salt within the week if attempts to inflate prices continue, Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe said.

title: AI operated devices to monitor buses: Minister
byline: The Government has decided to use AI operated devices to monitor buses, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: Shanakiyan Rajaputhiran presents private member’s Bill to hold PC elections
byline: Parliamentarian Shanakiyan Rajaputhiran Rasamanickam presented a private member’s Bill titled ’’Bill to amend the Provincial Councils Elections Act, No 2 of 1988’’, aiming to hold the Provincial Council elections.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today to provide a statement regarding fertiliser importation during his time in office.

title: Two illegal Israeli religious centres identified in Potuvil, Thimbirigasyaya: Minister
byline: Religious and Cultural Affairs Minister Hiniduma Sunil Senevi revealed today that four Israeli religious centres have been found to be operating in Sri Lanka and two of them have not been registered.

title: Ravi K’s allegation on non-availability of annexures to oral question answers false: Speaker
byline: The allegation made by MP Ravi Karunanayake on the non-availability of annexures to answers given for oral questions is false, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne told Parliament today.

title: Medical professionals launch token strike
byline: Supplementary medical professionals across the country launched an island-wide token strike at 8:00 a.m. today pressing for the resolution of five key demands.

title: Wipers of new airbus not functioning: SJB MP
byline: It was noticed during the traditional water canon salute that the wipers of the new airbus are not functioning, SJB MP Nalin Bandara said today.

title: Ministry urges schools to step up mosquito control amid dengue, Chikungunya threat
byline: With the onset of the monsoon season increasing the risk of mosquito-borne diseases, authorities have instructed all Provincial and Zonal Education Directors to ensure that school environments across the island are kept clean and free of mosquitoes.

title: Three Maori MPs suspended over ’intimidating’ haka
byline: New Zealand’s parliament has voted to suspend three Māori MPs for their protest haka during a sitting last year.

title: Train collision narrowly avoided after signal failure
byline: A serious incident was narrowly averted this morning when two trains were found running dangerously close to each other on the same track along the coastal railway line, due to a fault in the signals system.

title: Supreme Court grants leave to hear FR petitions over demolition of Soul Beach Hotel
byline: The Supreme Court granted leave to proceed with three Fundamental Rights petitions challenging the legality of the demolition of Soul Beach (Pvt) Ltd., a beachside hotel in Dehiwala, as part of the former government’s Yukthiya anti-narcotics operation.

title: Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister and Anuradhapura District Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until June 19 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court.

title: Two FR petitions challenging legality of Sri Lanka-India MoUs fixed for June 12
byline: Two Fundamental Rights petitions filed seeking an order to invalidate the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) recently signed between Sri Lanka and India were today fixed for June 12 by the Supreme Court.

title: Covid-19 cases in India surge to 4,866; 5-month-old among 7 deaths in 24 hours
byline: India has witnessed a surge in Covid-19 cases over the past 24 hours, with the number of active cases rising from 4,302 to 4,866 on Thursday. During the same period, 7 deaths have been reported across the country.

title: CSE continues positive momentum on strong investor sentiment
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a positive note today, maintaining its upward trajectory with an increase of 81.89 points, or 0.47%, to close at 17,434.94. Similarly, the S&P SL20 Index recorded a gain of 27.12 points, representing a 0.55% rise, to end the day at 5,186.78.

title: Top defence officials of India and Sri Lanka meet in Colombo
byline: Indian Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh, leading a high-level delegation, held separate meetings today (Jun 05) with Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara and Defence Secretary Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd).

title: World loses 20 football fields of land every minute: Deputy Minister
byline: The environment is being badly damaged every minute, with an area equal to twenty football fields lost every minute, and about eight million tons of plastic waste released into the ocean every year, Deputy Minister of Sports Sugath Thilakaratne said.

title: Former Land Reclamation GM granted bail
byline: Former General Manager of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation Srimati Mallika Kumari Senadheera who was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption was released on bail.

title: Court sentences mother to 7 years rigorous imprisonment for attempting to sell newborn
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Navaratne Marasinghe today sentenced a 46-year-old mother to seven years of rigorous imprisonment after finding her guilty of attempting to sell a two day old infant for Rs. 75,000.

title: Goods in controversial 323 containers were weapons belonging to Prabhakaran: Archchuna
byline: The goods in the 323 controversial containers included weapons belonging to slain LTTE Leader Velupillai Prabhakaran, MP Ramanathan Archchuna told Parliament today.

title: Former Land Reclamation GM arrested over Rs. 27 Mn corruption allegation
byline: Former General Manager of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation Ms. M.R. Srimati Mallika Kumari Senadheera was arrested today by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Port trade unions warn of 'natural death' for Colombo Port amid administrative crisis
byline: The Colombo Port, long considered the economic heartbeat of Sri Lanka, is heading towards a ’natural death’ due to administrative mismanagement at the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA), Co-Convenor of the Joint Alliance of Port Trade Unions (JAPTU) Shyamal Sumanaratne warned.

title: Philippines grants 5-year TRVs to Sri Lankans married to Filipinos
byline: The Government of the Philippines has officially commenced the issuance of 5-year Temporary Residence Visas (TRVs) for Sri Lankans who are married to Filipino citizens.

title: Around 50% diesel, 15% petrol vehicles fail emission tests in Athurugiriya
byline: A special roadside smoke emission test conducted today in front of the Athurugiriya Police Station revealed that more than 50% of diesel vehicles and 15% of petrol vehicles on the road were emitting excessive smoke, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) said.

title: Chaos at Colombo National Hospital as Director vacancy continues
byline: The Colombo National Hospital, the largest and most vital medical institution in Sri Lanka, has been operating without a permanent director for over three months.

title: Marambe calls for foreign referees
byline: As the 2025 Inter-Schools Rugby League prepares for kickoff on June 6, former Sri Lanka captain and national selector Tikiri Marambe has called for higher refereeing standards to ensure fairness and flow in the country’s most-watched youth sport.
